Catalano.Imaging.Filters

Class Clahe

  • java.lang.Object
    • Catalano.Imaging.Filters.Clahe
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IBaseInPlace

    public class Clahe
extends java.lang.Object
implements IBaseInPlace
    Contrast Limited Adaptive Histogram Equalization. This feature can also be applied to global histogram equalization, giving rise to contrast limited histogram equalization (CLHE) which is rarely used in practice. References: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adaptive_histogram_equalization#Contrast_Limited_AHE

    • Method Detail

      • getBlockRadius

        public int getBlockRadius()
        Get Block radius. The size of the local region around a pixel for which the histogram is equalized. This size should be larger than the size of features to be preserved.
        Returns:
        Size of block radius.

      • setBlockRadius

        public void setBlockRadius(int blockRadius)
        Set Block radius. The size of the local region around a pixel for which the histogram is equalized. This size should be larger than the size of features to be preserved.
        Parameters:
        blockRadius - Size of block radius.

      • getBins

        public int getBins()
        Get the number of histogram bins used for histogram equalization.
        Returns:
        Number of histogram bins.

      • setBins

        public void setBins(int bins)
        Set the number of histogram bins used for histogram equalization.
        Parameters:
        bins - Number of histogram bins.

      • getSlope

        public float getSlope()
        Get Slope. Limits the contrast stretch in the intensity transfer function. Very large values will let the histogram equalization do whatever it wants to do, that is result in maximal local contrast. The value 1 will result in the original image.
        Returns:
        Slope.

      • setSlope

        public void setSlope(float slope)
        Set Slope. Limits the contrast stretch in the intensity transfer function. Very large values will let the histogram equalization do whatever it wants to do, that is result in maximal local contrast. The value 1 will result in the original image.
        Parameters:
        slope - Slope.
